text: It's a very, very elite group as such
with very high standards.

The accreditation is the Association to
Advance Collegiate Schools of Business

and is the top five percent of business
schools worldwide.
We had to me twenty standards
in order to qualify for AACSB.
These standards are really marks of quality schools.
If you look at any of the top schools -
Harvard, Columbia, Yale -
all those business schools have the exact same accreditation
that we now have with AACSB.

We've had faculty members routinely
publishing

at the twenty percentile where the
acceptance rate

is only 20 percent only ten percent of the top
journals in the nation.
And that's unusual - you don't see schools typically our size
being able to publish in these journals.

We're scoring in the eighty-fifth percentile or
higher

so our students are competitive with any
students across the nation.

We will be having visiting teams
come every five years
to re-evaluate our program and
see if we are still meeting the standards.

And it's a continuous improvement
program also.
So we gather data, we make corrections

and then we check to see that we're
improving.
